text: well here we are in sri sri rec center and our sri rec center at the farmers market as part of a partnership between the government the Ministry of Health and the BC Association of farmers markets where we are going to provide even more opportunity for BC families BC seniors to have access to the freshest tastiest fruit produce grown anywhere in the world BC homegrown produce coupon books that will be made available through our partnerships for families to come to farmers markets like this across British Columbia we give them to low-income families pregnant women and seniors who are participating in skill building programs like canning and learning about nutrition and cooking and then they use these coupons and they take them to the farmers market we're having it in 21 communities this year and because we received 2 million dollars it's going to ramp up considerably next year and then the next year even more so we'll be really in a lot of communities as the years go on right this is a fantastic program it will help most some of our clients to be able to connect to the farmers market those are be the individuals and families may otherwise not have the opportunity to come and shop here and then get connect to the farmers and connect to the land and to the food so it's very exciting a lot of people are looking forward to it it's a great initiative way to further promote BC produce and healthy living healthy diets
